snippet: Ben Lerner’s first novel, “Leaving the Atocha Station,” and the Hemingway classic “The Sun Also Rises” offer stark differences in the meaning of being an American.
abstract: Gary Sernovitz essay discusses the stark contrast between Ben Lerner's first novel Leaving the Atocha Station and the Hemingway classic The Sun Also Rises; says the two books offer stark differences on what it means to be an American abroad.
lead_paragraph: Ben Lerner’s first novel, “Leaving the Atocha Station,” and the Hemingway classic “The Sun Also Rises” offer stark differences in the meaning of being an American.

headline.seo: What ‘Leaving the Atocha Station’ Says About America
